title:
On the minimal (edge) connectivity of graphs and its applications to
  power graphs of finite groups
abstract:
In an earlier work, finite groups whose power graphs are minimally edge
connected have been classified. In this article, first we obtain a necessary
and sufficient condition for an arbitrary graph to be minimally edge connected.
Consequently, we characterize finite groups whose enhanced power graphs and
order superpower graphs, respectively, are minimally edge connected. Moreover,
for a finite non-cyclic group $G$, we prove that $G$ is an elementary abelian
$2$-group if and only if its enhanced power graph is minimally connected. Also,
we show that $G$ is a finite $p$-group if and only if its order superpower
graph is minimally connected. Finally, we characterize all the finite nilpotent
groups such that the minimum degree and the vertex connectivity of their order
superpower graphs are equal.
